meanings.definition: A person who has broken the law and is considered a criminal.
meanings.sent1: The outlaws were caught by the police and taken to jail.
meanings.sent2: The town was afraid of the outlaws who roamed the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The outlaws tried to steal candy from a baby, but they got caught!
meanings.sent4: The outlaws of the wild west were like modern-day pirates on land.
meanings.sent5: The image of the outlaws in their black masks was etched in his memory.

meanings.sent1: The school outlaws running in the hallways to keep students safe.
meanings.sent2: The new law outlaws smoking in public places to protect people's health.
meanings.sent3: The sign on the door outlaws pets inside the store, so leave your dog outside.
meanings.sent4: The strict rules outlaws any form of cheating during the exam.
meanings.sent5: The king's decree outlaws any discussion of rebellion under penalty of death.
